chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
X: Type
p: X -> Prop
Y: Type
q: Y -> Prop

Goal:
p ⪯ q -> (fun x : X => ~ p x) ⪯ (fun y : Y => ~ q y)

Premises:
dec_red : forall (X : Type) (p : X -> Prop) (Y : Type) (q : Y -> Prop), p ⪯ q -> decidable q -> decidable p
dec_compl : forall (X : Type) (p : X -> Prop), decidable p -> decidable (fun x : X => ~ p x)
reduction = fun (X Y : Type) (f : X -> Y) (P : X -> Prop) (Q : Y -> Prop) => forall x : X, P x < -> Q (f x) : forall X Y : Type, (X -> Y) -> (X -> Prop) -> (Y -> Prop) -> Prop Arguments reduction {X Y}%type_scope (_ _ _)%function_scope
reduces_transitive : forall (X : Type) (P : X -> Prop) (Y : Type) (Q : Y -> Prop) (Z : Type) (R : Z -> Prop), P ⪯ Q -> Q ⪯ R -> P ⪯ R
reduces_dependent : forall (X : Type) (P : X -> Prop) (Y : Type) (Q : Y -> Prop), P ⪯ Q < -> inhabited (forall x : X, {y : Y | P x <-> Q y})
BinPosDef.Pos.add = with add (x y : BinNums.positive) {struct x} : BinNums.positive := match x with | BinNums.xI p => match y with | BinNums.xI q => BinNums.xO (add_carry p q) | BinNums.xO q => BinNums.xI (add p q) | BinNums.xH => BinNums.xO (BinPosDef.Pos.succ p) end | BinNums.xO p => match y with | BinNums.xI q => BinNums.xI (add p q) | BinNums.xO q => BinNums.xO (add p q) | BinNums.xH => BinNums.xI p end | BinNums.xH => match y with | BinNums.xI q => BinNums.xO (BinPosDef.Pos.succ q) | BinNums.xO q => BinNums.xI q | BinNums.xH => BinNums.xO BinNums.xH end end with add_carry (x y : BinNums.positive) {struct...
dec_DM_impl : forall X Y : Prop, dec X -> dec Y -> ~ (X -> Y) -> X /\ ~ Y
reduces = fun (X Y : Type) (P : X -> Prop) (Q : Y -> Prop) => exists f : X -> Y, reduction f P Q : forall X Y : Type, (X -> Prop) -> (Y -> Prop) -> Prop Arguments reduces {X Y}%type_scope (_ _)%function_scope
impl_dec : forall X Y : Prop, dec X -> dec Y -> dec (X -> Y)
Exists_Forall_neg : forall (A : Type) (P : A -> Prop) (l : list A), (forall x : A, P x \/ ~ P x) -> Exists (fun x : A => ~ P x) l < -> ~ Forall P l
neg_Forall_Exists_neg : forall (A : Type) (P : A -> Prop) (l : list A), (forall x : A, {P x} + {~ P x}) -> ~ Forall P l -> Exists (fun x : A => ~ P x) l
Forall_Exists_neg : forall (A : Type) (P : A -> Prop) (l : list A), Forall (fun x : A => ~ P x) l < -> ~ Exists P l
decider = fun (X : Type) (f : X -> bool) (P : X -> Prop) => forall x : X, reflects (f x) (P x) : forall X : Type, (X -> bool) -> (X -> Prop) -> Prop Arguments decider {X}%type_scope (_ _)%function_scope
complement = fun (X : Type) (P : X -> Prop) (x : X) => ~ P x : forall X : Type, (X -> Prop) -> X -> Prop Arguments complement {X}%type_scope _%function_scope
reduces_reflexive : forall (X : Type) (P : X -> Prop), P ⪯ P
Forall_Exists_dec : forall (A : Type) (P : A -> Prop), (forall x : A, {P x} + {~ P x}) -> forall l : list A, {Forall P l} + {Exists (fun x : A => ~ P x) l}
dec = fun X : Prop => {X} + {~ X} : Prop -> Type Arguments dec _%type_scope
decidable = fun (X : Type) (P : X -> Prop) => exists f : X -> bool, decider f P : forall X : Type, (X -> Prop) -> Prop Arguments decidable {X}%type_scope _%function_scope
Field_theory.mk_sfield : forall (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul rdiv : R -> R -> R) (rinv : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop), Ring_theory.semi_ring_theory rO rI radd rmul req -> ~ req rI rO -> (forall p q : R, req (rdiv p q) (rmul p (rinv q))) -> (forall p : R, ~ req p rO -> req (rmul (rinv p) p) rI) -> Field_theory.semi_field_theory rO rI radd rmul rdiv rinv req
Field_theory.mk_field : forall (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul rsub : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (rdiv : R -> R -> R) (rinv : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop), Ring_theory.ring_theory rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp req -> ~ req rI rO -> (forall p q : R, req (rdiv p q) (rmul p (rinv q))) -> (forall p : R, ~ req p rO -> req (rmul (rinv p) p) rI) -> Field_theory.field_theory rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp rdiv rinv req
Field_theory.mk_afield : forall (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul rsub : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (rdiv : R -> R -> R) (rinv : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop), Ring_theory.almost_ring_theory rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp req -> ~ req rI rO -> (forall p q : R, req (rdiv p q) (rmul p (rinv q))) -> (forall p : R, ~ req p rO -> req (rmul (rinv p) p) rI) -> Field_theory.almost_field_theory rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp rdiv rinv req
Field_theory.SFdiv_def : forall (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul rdiv : R -> R -> R) (rinv : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop), Field_theory.semi_field_theory rO rI radd rmul rdiv rinv req -> forall p q : R, req (rdiv p q) (rmul p (rinv q))
Field_theory.AFdiv_def : forall (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul rsub : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (rdiv : R -> R -> R) (rinv : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop), Field_theory.almost_field_theory rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp rdiv rinv req -> forall p q : R, req (rdiv p q) (rmul p (rinv q))
Record semi_field_theory (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul rdiv : R -> R -> R) (rinv : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop) : Prop := mk_sfield { SF_SR : Ring_theory.semi_ring_theory rO rI radd rmul req; SF_1_neq_0 : ~ req rI rO; SFdiv_def : forall p q : R, req (rdiv p q) (rmul p (rinv q)); SFinv_l : forall p : R, ~ req p rO -> req (rmul (rinv p) p) rI } Arguments Field_theory.semi_field_theory [R]%type_scope _ _ (_ _ _ _ _)%function_scope Arguments Field_theory.mk_sfield [R]%type_scope [rO rI] [radd rmul]%function_scope (_ _)%function_scope [req]%function_scope _ _ (_ _)%function_scope
Zbool.Zeq_bool = fun x y : BinNums.Z => match BinInt.Z.compare x y with | Eq => true | _ => false end : BinNums.Z -> BinNums.Z -> bool Arguments Zbool.Zeq_bool (_ _)%Z_scope
Record almost_field_theory (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul rsub : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (rdiv : R -> R -> R) (rinv : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop) : Prop := mk_afield { AF_AR : Ring_theory.almost_ring_theory rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp req; AF_1_neq_0 : ~ req rI rO; AFdiv_def : forall p q : R, req (rdiv p q) (rmul p (rinv q)); AFinv_l : forall p : R, ~ req p rO -> req (rmul (rinv p) p) rI } Arguments Field_theory.almost_field_theory [R]%type_scope _ _ (_ _ _ _ _ _ _)%function_scope Arguments Field_theory.mk_afield [R]%type_scope [rO rI] [radd rmul rsub ropp]%function_scope (_ _)%function_scope [req]%function_scope _ _ (_ _)%function_scope
Record field_theory (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul rsub : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (rdiv : R -> R -> R) (rinv : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop) : Prop := mk_field { F_R : Ring_theory.ring_theory rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp req; F_1_neq_0 : ~ req rI rO; Fdiv_def : forall p q : R, req (rdiv p q) (rmul p (rinv q)); Finv_l : forall p : R, ~ req p rO -> req (rmul (rinv p) p) rI } Arguments Field_theory.field_theory [R]%type_scope _ _ (_ _ _ _ _ _ _)%function_scope Arguments Field_theory.mk_field [R]%type_scope [rO rI] [radd rmul rsub ropp]%function_scope (_ _)%function_scope [req]%function_scope _ _ (_ _)%function_scope
BinInt.Z.lt = fun x y : BinNums.Z => BinInt.Z.compare x y = Lt : BinNums.Z -> BinNums.Z -> Prop Arguments BinInt.Z.lt (_ _)%Z_scope
BinInt.Z.gt = fun x y : BinNums.Z => BinInt.Z.compare x y = Gt : BinNums.Z -> BinNums.Z -> Prop Arguments BinInt.Z.gt (_ _)%Z_scope
ssrbool.classically = fun P : Type => forall b : bool, (P -> Datatypes.is_true b) -> Datatypes.is_true b : Type -> Prop Arguments ssrbool.classically _%type_scope
BinIntDef.Z.compare = fun x y : BinNums.Z => match x with | BinNums.Z0 => match y with | BinNums.Z0 => Eq | BinNums.Zpos _ => Lt | BinNums.Zneg _ => Gt end | BinNums.Zpos x' => match y with | BinNums.Zpos y' => BinPos.Pos.compare x' y' | _ => Gt end | BinNums.Zneg x' => match y with | BinNums.Zneg y' => CompOpp (BinPos.Pos.compare x' y') | _ => Lt end end : BinNums.Z -> BinNums.Z -> comparison Arguments BinIntDef.Z.compare (_ _)%Z_scope
Field_theory.gen_phiPOS_discr_sgn : forall (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul rsub : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (rdiv : R -> R -> R) (rinv : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop), Setoid.Setoid_Theory R req -> Ring_theory.ring_eq_ext radd rmul ropp req -> Field_theory.field_theory rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp rdiv rinv req -> (forall p : BinNums.positive, ~ req (InitialRing.gen_phiPOS1 rI radd rmul p) rO) -> forall x y : BinNums.positive, ~ req (InitialRing.gen_phiPOS rI radd rmul x) (ropp (InitialRing.gen_phiPOS rI radd rmul y))
False_dec = right (fun H : False => False_ind False H) : dec False
Ring_polynom.PExpr_ind : forall (C : Type) (P : Ring_polynom.PExpr C -> Prop), P Ring_polynom.PEO -> P Ring_polynom.PEI -> (forall c : C, P (Ring_polynom.PEc c)) -> (forall p : BinNums.positive, P (Ring_polynom.PEX C p)) -> (forall p : Ring_polynom.PExpr C, P p -> forall p0 : Ring_polynom.PExpr C, P p0 -> P (Ring_polynom.PEadd p p0)) -> (forall p : Ring_polynom.PExpr C, P p -> forall p0 : Ring_polynom.PExpr C, P p0 -> P (Ring_polynom.PEsub p p0)) -> (forall p : Ring_polynom.PExpr C, P p -> forall p0 : Ring_polynom.PExpr C, P p0 -> P (Ring_polynom.PEmul p p0)) -> (forall p : Ring_polynom.PExpr C, P p -> P (Ring_polynom.PEopp p)) ->...-> forall p : Ring_polynom.PExpr C, P p
Dec : forall X : Prop, dec X -> dec X
BinNums.positive_ind : forall P : BinNums.positive -> Prop, (forall p : BinNums.positive, P p -> P (BinNums.xI p)) -> (forall p : BinNums.positive, P p -> P (BinNums.xO p)) -> P BinNums.xH -> forall p : BinNums.positive, P p
not_dec : forall X : Prop, dec X -> dec (~ X)
ZCoeff.Zcneqb_morph : forall (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (rplus rtimes rminus : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (req rle rlt : R -> R -> Prop), OrderedRing.SOR rO rI rplus rtimes rminus ropp req rle rlt -> forall x y : BinNums.Z, Zbool.Zeq_bool x y = false -> ~ req (ZCoeff.gen_order_phi_Z rO rI rplus rtimes ropp x) (ZCoeff.gen_order_phi_Z rO rI rplus rtimes ropp y)
Bool.diff_false_true = fun H : false = true => let H0 : False := eq_ind false (fun e : bool => if e then False else True) I true H in False_ind False H0 : false <> true
Field_theory.SFinv_l : forall (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul rdiv : R -> R -> R) (rinv : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop), Field_theory.semi_field_theory rO rI radd rmul rdiv rinv req -> forall p : R, ~ req p rO -> req (rmul (rinv p) p) rI

```coq
intros.
unfold reduces.
exists (fun x => match dec (q x) with
                | left _ => false
                | right _ => true
                end).
intros x. split.
- intro H. destruct (dec (q x)).
  + contradiction H. apply H0.
  + reflexivity.
- intro H. destruct (dec (q x)).
  + discriminate.
  + contradiction H.
Qed.```

original: intros. unfold reduces. exists (fun x => match dec (q x) with | left _ => false | right _ => true end). intros x. split. - intro H. destruct (dec (q x)). + contradiction H. apply H0. + reflexivity. - intro H. destruct (dec (q x)). + discriminate. + contradiction H.
